TopicTitle: How do I make a floating base?

Articles.Content:
So... this is my future "Laythe Base - Boat Dock" base. Its purpose when I get it done, will serve as a boat spawning/launching area, and refueling.

I'm trying to get this thing to float right. What's the secret to get it to float how you want it? I had assumed the ringed Fuel Tanks would help it.

Plus I can't activate the sphere launchpad, which is the reason I'm making this thread. I'm also using the "Sea Sickness Cure" mod and confused on how to use it. It's just a cone, and I assume you place it on the surface you want a Kerbal to walk on.

I've been using HyperEdit to place it on Kerbin as a test.

EDIT: Answered. Extending the walkway did balance it. Thank you, HoY for the suggestion to use pontunes, and Captain Serria for the (should had been obvious to me!) suggestion to make the base not look tipped over.

Edited July 21, 2013 by Benie

-snip-

I would look at adding some floating boat parts to the bottom of the legs possibly? The boat part pack has some of those. Fire spitter also has some sea plane pontunes you can use. There's a mod that has a water prop as well to move the contraption once its in the water.

Edited July 21, 2013 by Benie

Unfortunately, as I said, the RocketParts capsules make it sink. This is no good. I can't have it sink if I'm also going to use it for refueling.

You could edit the RocketParts resource to be less dense and so not sink, or you could only give the RocketParts hexcans a fraction of a full load. I'm building a floating launchpad on Laythe right now with the Hooligan Labs pad, 8 large RP hexcans, 4 orange tanks, and 4 large RCS tanks. I've got the hexcans holding 20 RocketParts each and the base floats nicely.

I put it near the shore because I plan on putting a colony on the ground nearby. It is free floating, not resting on the ground.
